reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPeople who are reviewing this game with giving It a negative review are either dumb or stupid or very selfish by putting down the developers. Early access games means that It's a work in progress. meaning not complete. When you people buy an early access title your basically helping the developers with developing the game. I would wait until a few months have gone by before giving this game a negative review. Wait until the developers have had a chance to add features and start fixing the bugs. I mean guys really stop acting like a bunch of jerks. Sure this game is not ready yet but that's what early acecess is about.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an Early Access review.

The developer is very active with forum feedback and suggestions so updates are promising. There is a lot to be done before this is ready to leave EA.

Ultimate Fight Manager 2016 blends RT with management as you manage your own gym and fighters in a MMA world. Build your gym staff, look after training schedules and fights, hire fighters, and buy equipment. These are the options at EA launch to play around with. You can challenge your friends or others in training fights at the moment, but you can not affect any strategy changes or offer corner advice during a fight. This is on the update list.

The game has an extensive update list that is free to view in the forum and I see that it could be a game title for MMA similar to how Football Manager is a popular title for sim-management football.

As of 30th April 2016. I recommend this as a purchase IF you are prepared to offer feedback to the devs, and are willing to be part of the Early Access process. This isn't a complete game with all the features. This is a game with only some of the features as shown. You can enjoy some of the basics, plan fights against others online, or against the AI.

This review will be added to as the game progresses through EA towards full-game launch.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very rough right now, I would not buy it in the current state.
Wait some days, see what the developers respond back with, and see if it improves in the future.

EDIT:
I will however say that I am sure the developer will work hard on this game! He already asked people what features they would like to see implemented, and has taken note.
This is definitely one to look for in the future, but as of right now it needs a loving hand from the developer.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWell what can i say, this one was the first game ive bought here in Steam and most likely will be the last one. U really think its funny or what? Saying im shoked is saying nothing
date: u know... But im shoked even more by Steam's team unability to check what they really got on their market. Shame on u guys."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would not recommend anyone to buy this game, it's still way to soon.

The game is very bare-bones, with so few features that in my oppionion it shouldn't even be released on Early Access yet.

On the plus side, the developer does seem quite active and interested in feedback.

Check back in 6 months time....
